definition: gauze hat/(fig.) job as an official
black hat (worn by feudal official)/fig. official post
lit. to lose one's black hat/to be sacked from an official post

sentences.english: The officer ended up losing his job because he accepted a bribe.
sentences.chinese: 由于收受贿赂，这个官员最终丢掉了自己的纱帽。

sentences.english: As on the preceding day, she wore her damask gown and her crape bonnet.
sentences.chinese: 她呢，和昨天一样，花缎裙袍，绉纱帽。

sentences.english: Yan Wang is normally depicted wearing a Chinese judge's cap and sometimes appears on Chinese Hell Bank Notes.
sentences.chinese: 阎王通常戴着一顶乌纱帽，纸钱上也会有他的形象。

sentences.english: If the gender ratio in a region in the province is too high, its leaders will be sacked.
sentences.chinese: 该省性别比例过高的地方，政府领导将被摘掉乌纱帽。

definition: official robe worn by ministers during the Ming 明 (1368-1644) and Qing 清 (1644-1911) dynasties
everyday robe worn at home in ancient times/robe worn by priests, monks and scholars
long gown/cheongsam/traditional Asian dress for men or (in Hong Kong) women's qipao
black hat (worn by feudal official)/fig. official post
Chinese skullcap resembling the skin of half a watermelon
buttoned mandarin jacket of the Qing dynasty 清代[Qing1 dai4] (1644-1911)
